greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: T(n,k) is the number of rooted strong triangulations of a disk with n interior nodes and 3+k nodes on the boundary.
comment: A strong triangulation is one in which no interior edge joins two nodes on the boundary. Except for the single triangle which is enumerated by T(0,0) these are the 3-connected triangulations.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1325
William T. Tutte, A census of planar triangulations, Canad. J. Math. 14 (1962), 21-38.
xref: Cf. A146305 (not necessarily strong triangulations), A210664, A341923, A342053.
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Feb 23 2021
